WAP.content: fidelity to an absolute quasi-contract w/ no history: not irresponsibility, but more imperative one, right not to have to appear before (account to) this or that regime (of appearing)
WAP.linkedContent: fidelity to an absolute quasi-contract w/ no history: not irresponsibility, but more imperative one, right not to have to appear before (account to) this or that regime (of appearing)

WAP.content: double bind of philosophical commitment or pledge (droit, if a philosopheme, also submitted to law of double bind: unstable, deconstructible, it precedes itself, calls for indestructible responsibility)
WAP.linkedContent: double bind of philosophical commitment or pledge (droit, if a philosopheme, also submitted to law of double bind: unstable, deconstructible, it precedes itself, calls for indestructible responsibility)

WAP.content: indestructible responsibility (because always revived in anxious raising of stakes [relancée dans une surenchère inquiète]) makes good conscience impossible
WAP.linkedContent: indestructible responsibility (because always revived in anxious raising of stakes [relancée dans une surenchère inquiète]) makes good conscience impossible

FK.content: one can’t deny that possibility deconstructs the necessity, given figure or logic of denial (dénégation) > place where reason, science, philosophy, thought retain same resource as religion
FK.linkedContent: one can’t deny that possibility deconstructs the necessity, given figure or logic of denial (dénégation) > place where reason, science, philosophy, thought retain same resource as religion

FL.content: justice is undeconstructible [see SPOM p. 33 deconstruction’s injunction, where it takes shape, its reaffirmed affirmation: thinking gift of undeconstructible justice]
FL.linkedContent: justice is undeconstructible [see SPOM p. 33 deconstruction’s injunction, where it takes shape, its reaffirmed affirmation: thinking gift of undeconstructible justice]

FL.content: deconstruction is possible as an experience of the impossible, wherever one can replace, translate, determine the X of justice, wherever there is (the undeconstructible)
FL.linkedContent: deconstruction is possible as an experience of the impossible, wherever one can replace, translate, determine the X of justice, wherever there is (the undeconstructible)

SPOM.content: deconstruction takes shape in thinking gift and undeconstructible justice > always risking evil, expropriation and injustice, only way to render justice to the other as other, the irreducible possibility of Un-Fug
SPOM.linkedContent: deconstruction takes shape in thinking gift and undeconstructible justice > always risking evil, expropriation and injustice, only way to render justice to the other as other, the irreducible possibility of Un-Fug

SPOM.content: “a deconstructive thinking, the one that matters to me here, has always pointed out the irreducibility of affirmation and therefore of the promise, as well as the undeconstructibility of a certain idea of justice…”
SPOM.linkedContent: “a deconstructive thinking, the one that matters to me here, has always pointed out the irreducibility of affirmation and therefore of the promise, as well as the undeconstructibility of a certain idea of justice…”

MPM.content: uncontrollable necessity, nonsubjectivizable law of thought beyond interiorization, beyond un-mourning thought mourning > can we accept it? affirm it? can no longer become a question
MPM.linkedContent: uncontrollable necessity, nonsubjectivizable law of thought beyond interiorization, beyond un-mourning thought mourning > can we accept it? affirm it? can no longer become a question

MPM.content: de Man’s texts on promise pervert tranquil assurance of what we call “performative” > too much of promise is irremediable disturbance/perversion, is also a trap, also renders promise possible (indestructible), and comical
MPM.linkedContent: de Man’s texts on promise pervert tranquil assurance of what we call “performative” > too much of promise is irremediable disturbance/perversion, is also a trap, also renders promise possible (indestructible), and comical

PS.content: fatal complicity Artaud reveals: all destructive discourses must inhabit structures they demolish, must shelter indestructible desire for full presence, nondifference: à la fois vie et mort
PS.linkedContent: fatal complicity Artaud reveals: all destructive discourses must inhabit structures they demolish, must shelter indestructible desire for full presence, nondifference: à la fois vie et mort

AF.content: “I shall say we” to a ghost or newborn > indestructible covenant, extraordinary performative (like a circumcision)
AF.linkedContent: “I shall say we” to a ghost or newborn > indestructible covenant, extraordinary performative (like a circumcision)

A.content: abyssal inquiry re: Heidegger’s delimitation of death, modes of ending, more than one limit, ends of man an indestructable (increvable) subject > death of Dasein not end of man, btwn the 2 there’s a divisible limit, perhaps, of ending, place where ending ends [?]
A.linkedContent: abyssal inquiry re: Heidegger’s delimitation of death, modes of ending, more than one limit, ends of man an indestructable (increvable) subject > death of Dasein not end of man, btwn the 2 there’s a divisible limit, perhaps, of ending, place where ending ends [?]

VM.content: community of question, unbreachable (inentamable) responsibility, impossible has already occurred [beings, history] > there’s a history of the question, pure memory of pure question makes possible all inheritance, announces an injunction, discipline: question must be maintained
VM.linkedContent: community of question, unbreachable (inentamable) responsibility, impossible has already occurred [beings, history] > there’s a history of the question, pure memory of pure question makes possible all inheritance, announces an injunction, discipline: question must be maintained

VM.content: why does Levinas return to categories he rejected? Derrida’s not denouncing incoherence [w/ this question], he’s wondering about meaning of necessity, necessity of lodging oneself w/in traditional conceptuality in order to destroy it—does this imposed necessity cache-t-elle quelque ressource indestructible et imprévisible du logos grec? quelque puissance illimitée d’enveloppement dans laquelle celui qui voudrait le repousser serait toujours déjà surpris?
VM.linkedContent: why does Levinas return to categories he rejected? Derrida’s not denouncing incoherence [w/ this question], he’s wondering about meaning of necessity, necessity of lodging oneself w/in traditional conceptuality in order to destroy it—does this imposed necessity cache-t-elle quelque ressource indestructible et imprévisible du logos grec? quelque puissance illimitée d’enveloppement dans laquelle celui qui voudrait le repousser serait toujours déjà surpris?

VM.content: “syntax of the Site whose archaic description is not legible on the metal of language cannot be erased: it is this metal itself, its too somber solidity and its too shining brilliance”
VM.linkedContent: “syntax of the Site whose archaic description is not legible on the metal of language cannot be erased: it is this metal itself, its too somber solidity and its too shining brilliance”

TB.content: does a work require translation? answer is apodictic, injunction even w/out translator there, the requirement of the other as translator: structure of original, relation of life to survival > a priori, even if forgotten > its apodictic essence: it is unforgettable, so forgetting is accidental, death would not change it at all
TB.linkedContent: does a work require translation? answer is apodictic, injunction even w/out translator there, the requirement of the other as translator: structure of original, relation of life to survival > a priori, even if forgotten > its apodictic essence: it is unforgettable, so forgetting is accidental, death would not change it at all

TB.content: translation, desire for translation, unthinkable w/out correspondence w/ thought of God
TB.linkedContent: translation, desire for translation, unthinkable w/out correspondence w/ thought of God

RGE.content: negative theology: still reserved, perhaps, a “superessentiality,” an indestructible meaning? > touching on limits & greatest audacities of discourse in Western thought
RGE.linkedContent: negative theology: still reserved, perhaps, a “superessentiality,” an indestructible meaning? > touching on limits & greatest audacities of discourse in Western thought

PIO.content: the double, indivisible movement of invention: gives place (donne lieu) to an event and produces a machine by introducing a gap (écart) in habit; novelty must surprise: no status ready/waiting to reduce it to the same
PIO.linkedContent: the double, indivisible movement of invention: gives place (donne lieu) to an event and produces a machine by introducing a gap (écart) in habit; novelty must surprise: no status ready/waiting to reduce it to the same

HLP.content: Derrida doesn’t believe that the effect of the lie, of betrayed veracity, remains indestructible as symptom [either way, logic of symptom can’t be contained w/in opposition good/bad faith]
HLP.linkedContent: Derrida doesn’t believe that the effect of the lie, of betrayed veracity, remains indestructible as symptom [either way, logic of symptom can’t be contained w/in opposition good/bad faith]

TR.content: plus de faute [no more fault, more fault] > vicious circle of excusing & being guilty
TR.linkedContent: plus de faute [no more fault, more fault] > vicious circle of excusing & being guilty

TR.content: guilt as inscription that is ineffaceable, inexorable, inexonerable
TR.linkedContent: guilt as inscription that is ineffaceable, inexorable, inexonerable

AFR.content: for Condillac, sensation is unmodifiable, first material, immediate presence, but also a germ for analogic sign > degrees of intensity, good analogy, “identical proportions”
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, sensation is unmodifiable, first material, immediate presence, but also a germ for analogic sign > degrees of intensity, good analogy, “identical proportions”

AFR.content: sensationalist metaphysics, via analogic, develops into semiotism: sign unfolds (développe) germ
AFR.linkedContent: sensationalist metaphysics, via analogic, develops into semiotism: sign unfolds (développe) germ

PSSS.content: a task w/out horizon for a new psychoanalytic Enlightenment: will calculate w/ the inflexible unconditionality of the unconditional [think POOF, counting event of friendship]
PSSS.linkedContent: a task w/out horizon for a new psychoanalytic Enlightenment: will calculate w/ the inflexible unconditionality of the unconditional [think POOF, counting event of friendship]

C.content: the odd is indivisible, remainder remains entire

LI.content: “self-presence” as desire/need is not simply a linguistic superstition Derrida keeps alive to win an argument, it is indestructible, “immortal”—also death, mortifère (death bearing) > is not “pure realization of self presence” also death?
LI.linkedContent: “self-presence” as desire/need is not simply a linguistic superstition Derrida keeps alive to win an argument, it is indestructible, “immortal”—also death, mortifère (death bearing) > is not “pure realization of self presence” also death?

TN.content: intuitionistic-continuistic logic of immediacy as irrepressible as desire itself, as intractable as language constraints, grammatical violence > this law has to happen, symptoms will crop up [does Nancy really avoid this logic?]
TN.linkedContent: intuitionistic-continuistic logic of immediacy as irrepressible as desire itself, as intractable as language constraints, grammatical violence > this law has to happen, symptoms will crop up [does Nancy really avoid this logic?]

TN.content: who could finish w/ this tempting postulation? [i.e. “smooth” desire]
TN.linkedContent: who could finish w/ this tempting postulation? [i.e. “smooth” desire]

OG.content: w/out exteriority of signifier, there is no sign, together they keep an indestructible solidity, can’t just “move on to something else”
OG.linkedContent: w/out exteriority of signifier, there is no sign, together they keep an indestructible solidity, can’t just “move on to something else”

OG.content: desire to restrict (lier) le jeu is irresistible
OG.linkedContent: desire to restrict (lier) le jeu is irresistible

OG.content: parousia of voice, presence to self of logos w/in voice, absolute hearing-oneself-speak, is a function responding to an indestructible but relative necessity w/in system that encompasses it
OG.linkedContent: parousia of voice, presence to self of logos w/in voice, absolute hearing-oneself-speak, is a function responding to an indestructible but relative necessity w/in system that encompasses it

OG.content: language couples prohibition & transgression endlessly, point of nonreplacement doesn’t exist > that which is elusive in our indestructible & mortal desire
OG.linkedContent: language couples prohibition & transgression endlessly, point of nonreplacement doesn’t exist > that which is elusive in our indestructible & mortal desire

OG.content: “to supplant/compensate for (suppléer)” defines writing, adds itself to presence, defers it in indestructible desire to rejoin it
OG.linkedContent: “to supplant/compensate for (suppléer)” defines writing, adds itself to presence, defers it in indestructible desire to rejoin it

EU.content: Derrida believes in indestructibility of ordered procedures of legitimation, titles, diplomas
EU.linkedContent: Derrida believes in indestructibility of ordered procedures of legitimation, titles, diplomas

SPEC.content: demonic in scene of writing/inheritance: en se précédant de son annonce auprès de qui tient lieu prêt pour sa revenue [announcement for those who will hold its place when it comes back] > hope that message will become archival, or indestructible monument of interrupted en-voie
SPEC.linkedContent: demonic in scene of writing/inheritance: en se précédant de son annonce auprès de qui tient lieu prêt pour sa revenue [announcement for those who will hold its place when it comes back] > hope that message will become archival, or indestructible monument of interrupted en-voie

FV.content: indestructibility of letter functions as pact binding 2 “singularities,” excludes all double simulacra: [in Lacan] subject is very divided, but phallus is not to be cut > at origin/end, there’s a word that doesn’t trick: the truth of the lure [p. 466n indivisibility in repetition compulsion]
FV.linkedContent: indestructibility of letter functions as pact binding 2 “singularities,” excludes all double simulacra: [in Lacan] subject is very divided, but phallus is not to be cut > at origin/end, there’s a word that doesn’t trick: the truth of the lure [p. 466n indivisibility in repetition compulsion]
